Module com.github.jh3nd3rs0n.jargyle.client
Package com.github.jh3nd3rs0n.jargyle.client

Class DatagramSocketFactory

java.lang.Object
com.github.jh3nd3rs0n.jargyle.client.DatagramSocketFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
SocksDatagramSocketFactory
public abstract class DatagramSocketFactory extends Object
A factory that creates DatagramSockets.

  • Constructor Summary

    Allows the construction of subclass instances.

  • Constructor Details

      public DatagramSocketFactory()
      Allows the construction of subclass instances.

  • Method Details

    • getDefault

      public static DatagramSocketFactory getDefault()
      Returns the default instance of DatagramSocketFactory. The default instance creates plain DatagramSockets.
      Returns:
      the default instance of DatagramSocketFactory

    • getInstance

      public static DatagramSocketFactory getInstance()
      Returns a DatagramSocketFactory. If the system property socksClient.socksServerUri is set and the value is valid, a new SocksDatagramSocketFactory is returned. Otherwise, the default instance of DatagramSocketFactory from getDefault() is returned.
      Returns:
      a DatagramSocketFactory

    • newDatagramSocket

      public abstract DatagramSocket newDatagramSocket() throws SocketException
      Returns a new DatagramSocket bound to any available local port and the wildcard address.

      Documentation is based from DatagramSocket().

      Returns:
      a new DatagramSocket bound to any available local port and the wildcard address
      Throws:
      SocketException - if the DatagramSocket could not be opened or bound

    • newDatagramSocket

      public abstract DatagramSocket newDatagramSocket(int port) throws SocketException
      Returns a new DatagramSocket bound to the provided local port and the wildcard address.

      The provided local port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. A provided local port of 0 will let the system pick up an available port. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided local port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      Documentation is based from DatagramSocket(int).

      Parameters:
      port - the provided local port
      Returns:
      a new DatagramSocket bound to the provided local port and the wildcard address
      Throws:
      SocketException - if the DatagramSocket could not be opened or bound to the provided local port

    • newDatagramSocket

      public abstract DatagramSocket newDatagramSocket(int port, InetAddress laddr) throws SocketException
      Returns a new DatagramSocket bound to the provided local port and the provided local InetAddress.

      The provided local port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. A provided local port of 0 will let the system pick up an available port. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided local port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      If the provided local InetAddress is null or a wildcard address, the DatagramSocket will be bound to the wildcard address.

      Documentation is based from DatagramSocket(int, InetAddress).

      Parameters:
      port - the provided local port
      laddr - the provided local InetAddress (can be null)
      Returns:
      a new DatagramSocket bound to the provided local port and the provided local InetAddress
      Throws:
      SocketException - if the DatagramSocket could not be opened or bound to the provided local port

    • newDatagramSocket

      public abstract DatagramSocket newDatagramSocket(SocketAddress bindaddr) throws SocketException
      Returns a new DatagramSocket bound to the provided local SocketAddress or a new unbound DatagramSocket if the provided local SocketAddress is null.

      Documentation is based from DatagramSocket(SocketAddress).

      Parameters:
      bindaddr - the provided local SocketAddress (can be null)
      Returns:
      a new DatagramSocket bound to the provided local SocketAddress or a new unbound DatagramSocket if the provided local SocketAddress is null
      Throws:
      SocketException - if the DatagramSocket could not be opened or bound to the provided local SocketAddress
